question: Test reports of outside branch circuits and feeders exceeding 1000 volts nominal, if required, shall be delivered to whom prior to energization?
Thermoplastic insulated fixture wire shall be marked at intervals not exceeding ______ inches?
Where cable assemblies with nonmetallic sheaths are used and extend into boxes through cable clamps, the sheath shall extend not less than ______ inch inside the box?
Branch circuit grounding conductors shall never be electrically connected to a grounded conductor of the system supplying the auto-transformer?
An open conductor assembly, less than 150 volts to ground, run overhead across a sidewalk shall have a minimum clearance above the sidewalk of ______ feet?
Overhead service drop conductors shall not be smaller than ______ AWG copper.
An enclosed channel of metal or nonmetallic materials designed expressly, with additional functions as permitted in this code is defined as?
Arc equipment that is less than ______ feet above the floor level and that may produce arcs, sparks, or particles of hot metal shall be of the totally enclosed type?
Metal faceplates in healthcare facilities, shall be permitted to be grounded by means of ______ screws securing the faceplate to a metal box?
Appliance receptacle outlets installed in a dwelling unit for specific appliances, such as laundry equipment, shall be installed within _______ feet of the intended location of the appliance?
Receptacle outlets in floors shall not be counted as part of the required number of receptacle outlets unless located within ______ inches of the wall?

In patient care spaces, luminaries located more than ______ feet above the floor and switches located outside of the patient care vicinity shall be permitted to be connected to an equipment grounding return path?
Type S fuses shall be of what type?
Generally, open multiconductor service cables, less than 1000 volts nominal, shall have a clearance of how much above roofs?
A non-metallic cable shall be secured at intervals not exceeding _______ feet and within _______ inches of the box?
When type IMC conduit is threaded in the field, a standard cutting die with a taper of 1 in 16 or _________ per foot shall be used?
Class II locations are those that are hazardous because of the presence of ______?
The overhead conductors between the service point and the first point of connection to the service-entrance conductors at the building or other structure are defined as?
What is the demand factor for household electric clothes dryers when there are 5 present?

A single panel or group of panel units designed for assembly in the form of a single panel, including buses and automatic overcurrent devices, and equipped with or without switches for the control of light, heat or power circuits.
For 18 AWG copper wire, what is one acceptable fuse class for overcurrent protection?
Cable type FMC shall be surely fastened in place by an approved means, within ______ inches of each box?
Circuit breakers used as switches in a fluorescent lighting circuit shall be listed and shall be marked what?

Where nonmetallic sheathed cable or multi-conductor Type UF cable is used with a single box not larger than 2 1/4 inches by 4 inches mounted in walls or ceilings, the cable shall be fastened within ______ inches of the box such that securing the cable to the box is not required?
Unless otherwise permitted, the general minimum size of electrical flexible metal conduit (FMC) is ______ inches electrical trade size?
Electrical equipment immersed in a protective liquid in such a way that an explosive atmosphere may be above the liquid or outside the enclosure cannot be ignited.
Each conduit run passing through Class 1 - Division 2 locations into an unclassified location shall be ______ at the boundary?
Thermal insulation shall not be installed within what dimension above a recessed luminaire enclosure?
Metal fences surrounding a substation shall be bonded to the grounding electrode when within ______ feet of an exposed electrical conductor?
A load not less than _______ volt-amperes shall be included for each 2-wire laundry branch circuit installed as required?

An enclosure supporting a luminaire may only be supported by rigid metal conduit when two or more threaded conduit runs are provided and each conduit shall be secured within ______ inches of the enclosure.
The connection of a grounding electrode conductor or bonding jumper to a grounding electrode shall be ______?
Which of the following is an approved method of grounding conductor connections to electrodes?

For unattended self-service motor fueling facilities, emergency controls shall be installed at a location acceptable by the authority having jurisdiction, the control shall be more than ________ feet from the dispensers and emergency controls shall shut off all power to all dispensing equipment.

Thermal insulation shall not be installed above a recessed luminaire or within _______ inches of the recessed luminaire's enclosure, wiring compartment, or ballast unless it is identified for contact with insulation, for non-type IC?
Neutral conductors for grounding a system over 1000 volts shall have a minimum insulation level of how much?
Conduit seals in a Class I, Division I location, when required, shall be installed within ______ inches from an enclosure?

All threaded conduit shall be made ______ to prevent sparking when fault current flows through the conduit system and to ensure the explosion proof or flameproof integrity of the conduit system where applicable?
Hermetically sealed protective techniques shall be acceptable for electrical and electronic equipment in hazardous (classified) locations. What is one of those classes?
Class II equipment for hazardous locations shall be marked to show the class, group and ______ temperature?
For straight pulls of conductors larger than 4 AWG, junction boxes shall be not be less than ______ times the trade size of the largest connecting raceway?
Type PVC conduit shall be an allowable wiring method in Class III locations?
In hotel guest rooms, branch circuits that supply luminaires must not have a voltage exceeding ______ between the conductors connected to the terminals?
In no case shall the point of attachment for overhead service-drop conductors be less than _______ feet above finish grade?
For a receptacle, what is the minimum width of a wall to require an outlet in a dwelling unit?
A 2,000 square foot lodge room shall have a minimum calculated lighting load no less than ______ VA for purposes of determining feeder and service loads?
Electrically heated utilization equipment in Class I Division 2 locations shall not exceed _________ percent of the ignition temperature in degrees of the gas or vapor?
What is not permitted for use as a grounding electrode?
Flammable gas, flammable liquid-produced vapor, or combustible liquid-produced vapor mixed with air that burns is in ______________ e.g. hydrogen?
Circuits leading to or through gasoline dispensing equipment shall have _______ at the boundary of the Class I area?
choices: A means to disconnect all conductors, including the neutral

question: When plate electrodes are used for grounding, each electrode shall expose a minimum of _____ to the surface of exterior soil?
choices: One half of a square foot

question: Where used outside, aluminum or copper-clad aluminum grounding conductors shall not be terminated within _______ inches of the earth?
Cellular concrete floor raceways shall have no conductor larger than _____ AWG installed in the raceway?
A cablebus shall be securely supported at intervals not exceeding ______ feet?
Three-way and four-way switches shall be wired so that all switching is done only in the _______ circuit conductor?
Fixture wire shall be permitted to be tapped into a 50-amp branch circuit conductor if the AWG of the fixture wire is what size?
Life safety and critical branches in health care facilities shall be automatically restored to operation within ______ seconds after interruption of the normal source power?
In dwelling units, 125-volt single-phase 15- and 20-ampere receptacles installed within ______ feet of the outside edge of the sink shall be provided with GFCI protection?
Receptacles located within the patient care area of pediatric wards, rooms, or areas shall have a listed ______ resistant cover?

The branch-circuit over-current device and conductors for fixed storage-type water heaters that have a capacity of 450 L (120 gal) or less shall have an ampere rating of not less than ______ percent of the ampere rating of the water heater?
Service entrance cables shall be supported by straps within what distance of every service head?
Boxes in walls shall be installed so that the front edge of the box is not more than how much from the edge of the finished surface?
Rigid metal conduit is allowed to be installed underground within 5 feet horizontally of a pools inside wall edge?
Type ENT cable _________ used where exposed to direct rays of the sun unless identified as sunlight resistance?

For multiconductor or multiplexed single-conductor cables having individually shielded conductors, the minimum bending radius is ______ times the diameter of the individually shielded conductors or ______ times the overall diameter, whichever is greater?
For permanently connected appliances rated at not over ______ horsepower, the branch circuit overcurrent device shall be permitted to serve as the disconnecting means.
The length of a cord for electronically operated kitchen waste disposers shall not be less than ______ inches and not over ______ inches?
Surface mounted fluorescent luminaires in closets shall have how much space between the wall or ceiling when installed above the door?
Feeder taps not over 25 feet must comply with three elements, what is one of them?
choices: Oversizing of conductors dependent upon the fault current maximum
Protection from physical damage by a raceway or approved means
Protection of conductors from wet locations by approved means
correct_answer: Protection from physical damage by a raceway or approved means

question: Cable type RMC shall be securely fastened within ______ feet of each outlet box, junction box, device box, and cabinet?

For equipment rated 1200 amperes or more and over 6 feet wide that contain overcurrent devices, there shall be one entrance not less than ______ inches wide and ______ feet high at each end of the working space?

No parts of cord connection luminaries, hanging luminaries, lighting track, pendants, or ceiling-suspended fans shall be located within a zone measured ______ feet horizontally and ______ feet vertically from the top of the bathtub rim or shower stall threshold?
A disconnecting means shall be provided for all ungrounded conductors derived from a stationary standby battery with a voltage over ______ volts dc?

A device designed to open and close a circuit by non-automatic means and to open the circuit automatically on a predetermined overcurrent without damage to itself when properly applied within its rating is defined as a _________?
Sheet steel boxes for electrical installations shall be made of steel not less than what thickness?
Receptacles installed on 15- and 20-amp branch circuits shall be of the ________ type?
Sheet metal auxiliary gutters shall be supported throughout their entire length at maximum intervals of ________ feet?
Generally, EMT smaller than ______ inch shall not be used?
Type MV cable shall be permitted for use on power systems rated up to ______ volts in a raceway, for wet and dry locations?
What is an acceptable service entrance conductor to be run in a cable tray?
Fixture wire shall not be smaller than what AWG?
Generally, an auxiliary gutter shall not extend a greater than ______ beyond the equipment it supplements?
Busways shall be permitted to be in the ______ where they are visible?
In a health care facility, life safety branches of an emergency system shall supply power for all of the following except ______?

Where a cable or raceway type wiring method is installed through bored holes, the holes shall be bored so that the edge of the hole is not less than ______ inches from the nearest edge of the wood member?
Conductors fill in a metallic box shall have how much free volume within for 1 conductor of 18 AWG and 3 of 6 AWG?
A flexible cord for an electrically operated and plug in-sink waste disposer shall have an equipment grounding conductor and shall be terminated with a grounding type attachment plug?
Type AC cable shall be secured by only staples, cable tie, hangers or fittings at intervals not exceeding _________ feet?

The space equal to the width and depth of equipment and extending from the floor to a height of ________ feet or to the structural ceiling, whichever is greater, shall be dedicated to the electrical installation for installations of 1000 volts or less?
Where electrical diagnostic equipment is to be used in Class I garage locations it shall have ______ protection for personnel?

In Class I, Division 1 locations, when entering an enclosure, the entry shall be metric designator 53, trade size ______ or larger and the enclosure contains terminals splices, or taps, a seal shall be placed in each conduit run entering the classified location?
The interior of spray booths and areas in the vicinity of spraying and painting are in a _______________ location?

To facilitate replacements in Class I, Division 2 locations, process control instruments shall be permitted to be connected through flexible cord and attachment plug and receptacle, the power-supply cord shall not exceed ______ feet?
Fixed space heating equipment without supplementary overcurrent protection that is over 1/8 horsepower shall have a disconnecting means located where?

In walls or ceilings with a surface of concrete, tile, gypsum, plaster, or other noncombustible material, boxes shall be installed so that the front edge of the box will not be set back of the finished surface more than an ____ inch?

In areas of Class I locations, lamps and lamp-holders for fixed lighting that is located over lanes through which vehicles are commonly driven shall not be less than ________ feet above the floor level?

Nonmetallic-sheathed cable shall be secured by staples, cable ties, straps, hangers, or similar fitting at intervals not exceeding ______ feet and within _______ inches of every cabinet, box, or fitting?
A XHHW type conductor shall have how much insulation when 6 AWG?

Required 125-volt, 15 and 20 ampere receptacles in dwelling units shall be installed so that at no point measured horizontally along the floor line in any wall space is more than ______ feet from a receptacle outlet?
The length of the cord for built-in trash compactors shall not be less than _____ feet and not more than ______ feet?
